Class Range

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.geertvanderpijpen.thinkinginjava.utils.Range

  • public class Range
extends java.lang.Object
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Produces int range arrays
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Geert Vanderpijpen

      Range()

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int[] range(int range)
      Returns a range of ints 0 to range
      static int[] range(int min, int max)
      Returns range [min, max[ as an int array
      static int[] range(int min, int max, int step)
      Returns range [min, max[ with defined steps as an int array

    • Method Detail

      • range

        public static int[] range(int range)
        Returns a range of ints 0 to range
        Parameters:
        range - upper boundary of the range (excluded)
        Returns:
        int array containing the desired range

      • range

        public static int[] range(int min,
                          int max)
        Returns range [min, max[ as an int array
        Parameters:
        min - Lower boundary of the range (included)
        max - Upper boundary of the range (excluded)
        Returns:
        int array containing the desired range

      • range

        public static int[] range(int min,
                          int max,
                          int step)
        Returns range [min, max[ with defined steps as an int array
        Parameters:
        min - Lower boundary of the range (included)
        max - Upper boundary of the range (excluded)
        step - The jump that is used in the range
        Returns:
        int array containing the desired range
